data.enText: She was born deaf and dumb .

data.text: Dumb used in this meaning is old-fashioned and can be offensive. It is better to use speech-impaired instead.
dumb用于此义是过时用法，可能含冒犯意，最好以speech-impaired代之。

data.chText: 一时说不出话的；不肯开口的
data.enText: temporarily not speaking or refusing to speak

data.chText: 我们都惊讶得说不出话来。
data.enText: We were all struck dumb with amazement.

data.chText: 我们坐在那里，默然无语。
data.enText: We sat there in dumb silence.
That was a pretty dumb thing to do.

data.chText: 如果警察盘问，你就装傻。
data.enText: If the police question you, act dumb (= pretend you do not know anything) .

data.chText: 在她早期的电影中，她扮演傻乎乎的金发女郎。
data.enText: In her early movies she played a dumb blonde .

data.chText: “你身体好吗？”劳拉默默地点了点头。
data.enText: ‘Are you all right?’ Laura nodded dumbly.

data.chText: （为使公众更易理解而）降低…的标准，减少…的专业性教育内容
data.enText: to make sth less accurate or educational , and of worse quality, by trying to make it easier for people to understand

ex.chText: 他又聋又哑，很少与他人交流。
ex.enText: He's deaf and dumb and so rarely communicates with others.

ex.chText: 这位官员被一名记者尖锐的问题弄得哑口无言。
ex.enText: The official was struck dumb by a reporter's sharp question.

synonyms.bx: 指因生理缺陷而不会说话的，许多人认为该词具有冒犯性，最好以speech-impaired 代替；也指因震惊、愤怒等而说不出话的。

ex.chText: 不会说话的人能交到朋友吗？
ex.enText: Can a mute person have friends?

ex.chText: 她站在那儿不说话，一副挑衅的样子。
ex.enText: She stood there, mute and defiant.

synonyms.bx: 指不会说话的，也指不说话或拒绝说话的。

data.chText: （为使公众更易理解而）降低…的标准，减少…的专业性教育内容
data.enText: to make sth less accurate or educational , and of worse quality, by trying to make it easier for people to understand

trans: 降低…的理解难度；减少…的专业内容

tr: unable to speak because of hereditary deafness
lacking the power of human speech

example: so dense he never understands anything I say to him
never met anyone quite so dim
although dull at classical learning, at mathematics he was uncommonly quick"- Thackera
dumb officials make some really dumb decisions
he was either normally stupid or being deliberately obtuse

value.def: Someone who is dumb is completely unable to speak.
If someone is dumb on a particular occasion, they cannot speak because they are angry, shocked, or surprised.

example.ex: We were all struck dumb for a minute.
example.tran: 一时间我们惊讶得哑口无言。

value.tran: (在某种场合下因愤怒或惊讶而)说不出话的,哑口无言的

example.ex: I shook my head dumbly, not believing him.
example.tran: 我一言不发地摇了摇头,不相信他的话。

value.def: If you call a person dumb, you mean that they are stupid or foolish.

example.ex: I've met a lot of dumb people...
The questions were set up to make her look dumb.
example.tran: 问题这么设计，就是为了让她出丑。

value.def: If you say that something is dumb, you think that it is silly and annoying.

example.ex: I came up with this dumb idea...

value.tran: 愚蠢的;令人心烦的;令人恼火的

value.def: Something that is dumb is done or expressed without words.

example.ex: An expression of dumb recognition wiggled across her features.
example.tran: 她不语，从她脸上掠过的一丝表情可知她是认得的。

value.tran: 无声的;无言的;不用言语表达的

example.ex: He accused broadcasters of contributing to the dumbing down of America.
example.tran: 他谴责广播员过分简化了美国的形象。
